titleStmt.title: World Wide Diplomatic Archives Index: Cuba
Cuba

div.head: Legislation
div.p: There is legislation that provides for the National Archives and the transfer of documents, but there is no legislation that governs access or freedom of information. In general, much pre-1959 documentation is available and post-revolution records are not.

div.head: Location
div.p: National Archives: Calle Compostela, No. 906, esq. San Isidro, Habana Viejo, Ciudad de La Habana.

div.head: Procedures
div.p: Foreign researchers must obtain a letter from a sponsoring Cuban institution as well as a special visa for researchers. For researchers wishing to consult pre-1959 documents, contact the National Archives. For post-1959 records, researchers may try to contact the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
